byline.contributor: Saeed Al-Batati reported from Al Mukalla, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo. Mohammed Ali Kalfood contributed reporting from Sana, Yemen.
byline.original: By SAEED AL-BATATI and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: Tensions escalate between Yemeni Pres Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi and Houthi rebels who forced his government into exile after 130 people, including 13 children, are killed in Sana by suicide bombers.
lead_paragraph: A day after two suicide bombings killed 130 people in Yemen’s capital, the president traded threats with the Houthi rebels who forced his government into exile.

headline.main: Threats by Yemen’s Warring Parties Escalate Crisis
headline.print_headline: Threats by Yemen’s Warring Parties Escalate Crisis

snippet: A day after two suicide bombings killed 130 people in Yemen’s capital, the president traded threats with the Houthi rebels who forced his government into exile.
